name: Candlewood Suites Jersey City

reviews.title: Great deal
Thoughtful touches, but too pricey for 'extended stay'
reviews.text: Arrived at Newark airport and had no trouble getting to the hotel (Airtrain to NJ Transit to PATH). Took about 40 minutes. If you want, take the NJ bus to the PATH instead of the train to save $6.

reviews.title: Good hotel, but questionable billing practices
reviews.text: The hotel is clean and newer. It is about a 5-7 minute walk from either the Pavonia PATH or Exchange Place PATH. The area is being rebuilt and is safe.

reviews.title: Safe location and great view of Manhattan Slyline
reviews.text: They were painting the hallways and doors as well as recarpeting the halls. Didn't matter to us but if you had a sensitivity to paint fumes you might have a problem. Mind you, they should be done by now. No smell entered the room.

reviews.title: Great Hotel, Convenient Location
reviews.text: Candlewood Suites, Jersey City, NJ. Look no further- you found it! We booked a one bedroom suite, which contained one double bed in bedroom and one comfortable pull out couch in living room/kitchen. We knew that the bed would not be a "queen" as advertised on the website. It has been our experience that most extended stay hotels call a double bed a queen. The room was spotless and very inviting. The staff could not have been more helpful and hospitable. Large table, kitchen with microwave and full size refrigerator. Cabinets contained pots, pans, utensils, flatware, plates, bowls, etc. The view from our room was nothing short of spectacular- the Empire State Building and the Hudson River. Two TV sets, and one VCR, and a video library in the lobby.

reviews.title: Loved the location
reviews.text: The hotel is a 10 minute -very safe - walk from the Pavonia/Newport PATH station. You'll pass one or two restaurants, two other hotels, condos and parking lots. If you choose, there is a light rail train that stops opposite the hotel, which can wisk you to the PATH station, as well as other Jersey points in a jiffy. Check out Hoboken for great shopping and night life. The PATH trains run all night, connecting you to six stations in Manhattan. There is a large shopping mall nearby. The parking is free and convenient. The hotel contains a 24 hour comissary, with items sold on the honor system. A large laundry room provides free washers and dryers. The hotel also runs a limited hour and area shuttle a few times a day. If you are arriving from NEWARK Airport, take the shuttle bus to Newark’s Penn Station, and jump on the PATH. You will not go wrong here - the convenience and benefits far outweigh the small inconvenience of walking to the train station.

reviews.title: A fantastic hotel
reviews.text: At night, you can walk a few steps and linger on the walkway overlooking the NYC Skyline on the Hudson River. We often took the PATH to Christopher Street and wandered the West Village. The PATH train also stops at 33rd Street - near Macy's. If you drive, traverse via the Holland Tunnel - but really - why bother. You're better off with the freedom of the PATH trains in combination with the NYC Transit System and WALKING. NYC is best enjoyed on foot. We searched websites obsessively until we found this gem – we recommend it, and we will call this our NYC “home.”

reviews.title: Good Value for the price and close to NYC!
reviews.text: We stayed here for a week in Feb and travelled into NYC each day. We were verry happy with the hotel staff and service. The location was really handy as well.

reviews.title: More than Adequate!
reviews.text: Just got back from my first-ever visit to NYC and stayed at this hotel on the advice of a friend. It was markedly cheaper than staying in Manhattan (I saved $150 just by not having to park in NYC), and it was clean, had great service, and was a short five-minute walk to the PATH train to NYC. The staff at the hotel were courteous and knowledgable. Jersey City itself isn't the nicest city around, but the area where the hotel is located is extremely safe and well-lit. I will definately stay at this hotel again when visiting NYC both because of the price and the quality stay.

reviews.text: The rate makes the place bearable. My advice is to check around and only book the Candlewood as a last resort. There are a few other properties that are much much much nicer for not too much more money.
reviews.title: New Mattresses a huge improvement!

reviews.text: I feel the need to update the review I gave this hotel Feb. 11, 2006 in which I stated their mattresses were way too firm for side sleepers. The new mattresses and bedding are ever so much better!! It was a very wise investment on their part and will keep us coming back in spite of having to change rooms this visit due to a problem with the a/c in our room.

reviews.title: Good location good price
Great hotel, excellent value
reviews.text: I stay here a lot and I'm almost reluctant to write about it because it is such great value. One bedroom apartments typically cost about $230 and studios about $200 a night.

reviews.title: Good basic hotel
reviews.text: In the 1 bedroom, you get a separate bedroom and living room with a well-equipped kitchen in one corner of the living room (4 hotplates, microwave, full-size refrigerator, pots, pans, cutlery, etc....) . The reclining chair in the living room is very comfortable; the sofa is ok; there is a large table which serves as a desk and an eating place and a very comfortbale working chair. The beds are not great quality but are acceptable -- the linens and blankets are cheap and scratchy but, I hear, being upgraded.

reviews.title: Great View of Lower Manhattan, Pefect Location
reviews.text: There is free broadband and a reasonably-priced phone service with a direct dial number for each apartment.

reviews.title: An economical choice, but not necessarily a good deal.
reviews.text: There is no restaurant or room service but there is a small store in the hotel selling fast food, drinks, fruit and breakfast items at very cheap prices (50 cents for a Coke, for example). There are very large nearby supermarkets and a shopping service. There are several decent restaurants in easy walking distance.

reviews.title: Unless you live in a trailer park you should steer clear of this place
reviews.text: Rooms are only cleaned once a week but you can ask for fresh towels if you need them.

aka: Candlewood Suites Jersey City Hotel Jersey City
description: Come and experience our new Comforts of Home bedding collection.The Candlewood Suites Jersey City is the only all suites hotel in the heart of the financial district of Jersey City, 214 suites, 8 floors, conveniently located near Harborside Financial Center, Exchange Place and Newport Financial Center. If New York City is your destination, the hotel is conveniently located between Exchange Place and Pavonia Path Stations. These trains will take you directly to midtown or lower Manhattan. Each spacious suite has a full kitchen complete with microwave and full size refrigerator. Work efficiently at your over-sized executive desk with free high-speed Internet access and two separate phone lines - check email and talk on the phone at the same time. Relax in the overstuffed recliner while you enjoy the CD player and VCR. Work off some stress in our fitness center or visit our Candlewood Cupboard. Whether your trip is for business or pleasure, our hotel can offer you the best value in the Jersey City and New York City area.Check out our special 'City Pass Package', which focuses on making your New York vacation more affordable.
